discussion.p: If we are supporting stateful deleters, we need an overload for reset that takes a deleter as well.

blockquote.pre: void reset( pointer p, deleter_type d);

discussion.p: We probably need two overloads to support move-only deleters, and this sounds uncomfortably like the two constructors I have been ignoring for now...

blockquote.p: Howard comments that we have the functionality via move-assigment.

discussion.p: Pointer-accepting overloads of reset() are discouraged - the same functionality is available via move-assignment and that is more idiomatic.
